intro: Phelipanche rosmarina, commonly known as common morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in the morning. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions and thrives in warm, humid climates. It has a climbing habit and produces a milky sap that can be toxic to some animals. Phelipanche rosmarina is often found in disturbed soils and can be considered a weed in agricultural settings.
